While the historical gene flow analysis (e.g., F-statistics; Tables 2 and 3, Suppl. 5) showed overall genetic similarities among temperate populations, contemporary gene flow analysis (assignment tests) indicated that all studied populations, including those in the peripheral temperate regions, are basically self-seeding (Suppl. 6). This result concords with the fact that peripheral temperate coral populations are mostly self-sustained by local spawning
31 . Recently expanded populations were therefore possibly seeded from other temperate populations by occasional long dispersal and then sustained themselves by self-seeding.
